abstracts.cdata!:
This is the implementation completion
            report (ICR) for the Mali education sector consolidation
            project (ESCP). The education adjustment component aimed to
            establish the global policy, financial and institutional
            framework for: (i ) expanding primary education access and
            equity; (ii) improving quality and relevance at all levels
            of the education system; and iii) increasing allocative
            efficiency of education resources, in favor or primary
            education. Bank's performance was satisfactory.
            Borrower's performance was satisfactory. The key
            lessons learned from this project were as follows: (i)
            rather than attempting adjustment and investment
            simultaneously, a sequential approach may be more effective;
            (ii) adequate financing is important to make the short-term
            benefits of reform greater than the costs; (iii) given the
            sensitive political nature of education sector reforms, a
            limiited number of strategic reform measures should be
            defined and phased in over time rather than introducing
            numerous controversial measures at one time; (iv) in
            situations of budgetary austerity it is difficult, if not
            impossible to develop primary education access and quality
            without effective controls on student flows to public
            secondary and higher education, especially in countries with
            low primary education enrollment ratios; and (v) new
            solutions should be explored which increasingly involve
            communities in school management and financing.

Mali - Education Sector Consolidation
            Project : Credit 2054 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Mali - Education Sector
            Consolidation Project : Credit 2054 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
The Education Sector Consolidation
            Project will help to sustain the momentum of far reaching
            educational policy reforms and to implement a core package
            of critically needed investment. This integrated program of
            reforms and investments aims at reshaping the unbalanced
            Malian education system, improving its performance and
            relevance and promoting a more cost effective use of scarce
            sectoral resources. Principally, this will be achieved by
            expanding access to primary education, but also by
            developing a viable option for secondary & higher
            education.   It will be hybrid in nature, consisting of,
            first, a quick disbursing element to be released in three
            yearly tranches against implementation of a sectoral
            adjustment program. Secondly, it will include an investment
            element focusing on primary education and the management of
            sectoral resources.
